intro: Lastreopsis exculta subsp. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan star moss, is a species of liverwort found in humid, tropical regions. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, closely spaced leaves that form a dense, carpet-like growth. The plant typically grows on moist rock surfaces or soil in shaded environments. Its leaves are usually green to reddish in color, depending on environmental conditions. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
